toc_entry.title: The Legacy Of Citizen Robert
toc_entry.description: as an heir to the Dallas Morning News, Robert Decherd has vindicated his father’s name, waged and won a newspaper war, and emerged as the new leader of the Dealey dynasty.

toc_entry.title: My Son the Biker
toc_entry.description: Is it any surprise that a toddler who goes to sleep clutching a screwdriver instead of a teddy bear grows into a fourteen-year-old with a passion for motorcycles?.
A photographic study on beating the heat.

toc_entry.title: “Tex”
toc_entry.subtitle: Texas Primer
toc_entry.description: It’s the best nickname you could have, even if you’ve never been to Texas.

toc_entry.title: The Ten Best And (Groan) the Ten Worst Legislators
toc_entry.description: We just rate them. You voted for them.
toc_entry.byline: by paul Burka and alison cook

toc_entry.title: Music To My Ears
toc_entry.description: The small-town orchestra has it all: performers who love the music passionately, audiences who lend their wholehearted support, and even occasional moments when all the instruments are playing the right note.

toc_entry.title: Give Me Back My Paper And Pencil
toc_entry.subtitle: Lifestyles
toc_entry.description: Trying to get a sick word processor fixed is enough to make us think twice about the technological revolution.

toc_entry.title: Make It Fresh, Make It Simple, And Make It Good
toc_entry.subtitle: Cooking
toc_entry.description: That may sound easy, but the combined constraints of the marketplace and the refrigerator’s contents make it a neat trick to put a satisfying meal on the table.

toc_entry.title: The Golden Age Of Apples And Oranges
toc_entry.subtitle: Art
toc_entry.description: The Kimbell’s exhibit of seventeenth-century Spanish still lifes is dazzling enough to cause a modern photo-realist to look again.

toc_entry.title: Boffo Brits
toc_entry.subtitle: Movies
toc_entry.description: The Shooting Party hits the bull’s-eye; Rambo: First Blood Part II makes Viet Nam the Club Med of mass death; a View to a Kill should have considered suicide.

toc_entry.title: No Babies Here
toc_entry.subtitle: Fatherhood
toc_entry.description: When the time comes for the last child in the family to relinquish her tattered baby blanket, she’s not the only one who’s a little shaky about it.

toc_entry.title: Behind the Lines
toc_entry.description: The dreamiest of the practical decisions.

toc_entry.title: Back Roads
toc_entry.description: Cloud seeding in the Hill Country.

toc_entry.title: Post-Modern Times
toc_entry.description: Sitcom City on Channel 27.

toc_entry.title: Downtown
toc_entry.description: Street barricading in Dallas.

toc_entry.title: Around the State
toc_entry.description: A selective statewide guide to entertainment and events.

toc_entry.title: Reporter
toc_entry.description: Dr Pepper finds itself; a Bandera hotel acts larger than life; COPS has an identity crisis.

toc_entry.title: Touts
toc_entry.description: The stars (and stripes) at night are big and bright.

toc_entry.title: The Roar Of the Crowd
toc_entry.description: Having fun with Shaggy; just being neighborly; debating the problems of the prisons.

toc_entry.title: State Secrets
toc_entry.description: Singing the blues at the Fort Worth Opera; reversing the Texas Supreme Court; computing the damage at TI; cooking with gas at FERC.
